channel.title: STAT 140: Introduction to the Ideas and Applications of Statistics on Stat 140 (Fall 2020)
channel.description: Recent content in STAT 140: Introduction to the Ideas and Applications of Statistics on Stat 140 (Fall 2020)

item.title: Schedule
item.description: Date Topic Formative Assignments Evaluative Assignments Unit 1 Data Summary and Visualization I Aug 24 (M) Welcome and introduction to statistics (html) Aug 25 (T) Data basics (html) 01 Data Camp, 01 Quiz, 01 Exercise Aug 26 (W) Categorical variable: distributions and proportional thinking (html) 02 Quiz, 02 Exercise Aug 27 (TH) Categorical variable: relationship between two variables (html) 03 Quiz, 03 Exercise Aug 28 (F) Categorical variable: working in R (html) 02 Data Camp, 04 Exercise EA1 (due Sep 04) Unit 2 Data Summary and Visualization II Aug 31 (M) Numerical variable: histograms and shapes (html) 04 Quiz, 05 Exercise Sep 01 (T) Numerical variable: summary of histograms (html) 05 Quiz, 06 Exercise Sep 02 (W) Numerical variable: relationship, association and correlation (html) 06 Quiz, 07 Exercise Sep 03 (TH) Relationship between numerical and categorical variable (html) 03 Data Camp Sep 04 (F) Putting it all together: exploratory data analysis (html) 07 Quiz, 08 Exercise EA2 (due Sep 11) Unit 3 Basic Regression Sep 08 (T) Introdution to linear models (html) 08 Quiz Sep 09 (W) How useful is your linear model (html) 09 Quiz, 09 Exercise Sep 10 (TH) Linear regression conditions (html) 10 Quiz, 10 Exercise Sep 11 (F) Regression over a categorical variable (html) 11 Quiz, 11 Exercise EA3 (due Sep 18) Unit 4 Sampling Sep 14 (M) Introduction to sampling (html) Mid-module break: nothing due Sep 15 (T) Designed experiments and observational studies (html) 12 Quiz, 12 Exercise Sep 16 (W) Sampling distribution (html) 13 Quiz, 13 Exercise Sep 17 (TH) Simulation based inference I (html) 14 Quiz, 14 Exercise Sep 18 (F) Simulation based inference II (html) 15 Exercise EA4 (due Sep 27) Unit 5 Basic Probability Sep 21 (M) A probability excursion (html) 15 Quiz, 16 Exercise Sep 22 (T) Binomial distribution (html) 16 Quiz, 17 Exercise Sep 23 (W) Binomial testing (html) 18 Exercise Sep 24 (TH) Normal distribution (html) 19 Exercise Sep 25 (F) Project bootcamp (html) EA5 (due Oct 02) Unit 6 CLT based inference Sep 28 (M) Central Limit Theorem (CLT) (html) 20 Exercise Sep 29 (T) CLT based confidence interval (html) 21 Exercise Sep 30 (W) CLT based hypothesis testing (html) 22 Exercise Oct 01 (TH) Project workshop I Oct 02 (F) Project workshop II (html) EA6, EA7 (due Oct 09) Unit 7 Topics in Inference Oct 05 (M) Mutiple means and proportions Oct 06 (T) Project workshop III Oct 07 (W) Statistics, AI and Ethics Oct 08 (TH) Project workshop IV Oct 09 (F) Project workshop V Unit X Tell your story with data Oct 12 (M) Concluding remarks

item.title: Syllabus
item.description: Inclusion & Accessibility This course is designed to be welcoming and accessible to all students. It is my goal for our learning environment to facilitate learning and intellectual development for everyone. If something was said in class (by anyone) that made you feel uncomfortable, or if there is some aspect of class that is not welcoming or accessible to you, please let me know immediately. Academic Accommodations AccessAbility Services is the office on campus that determines academic accommodations for students with disabilities.
